programme.title: Victory for Us | The Untold Story of India’s First Surf Team
programme.desc: El Salvador, World Surfing Games 2023, the Indian Surf Team participates for the very first time in an international event chasing their Olympic Qualification. This is the story of that journey, where those kids that once started surfing with broken boards reach an international stage for the first time, where they meet their surfing idols and earn experience for upcoming competitions. Watch it now!

programme.title: From NYC to Alaska, meet the pioneers and US champion | Breaking Life
programme.desc: As the birthplace of a global hip-hop movement, we meet some of the pioneers of Breaking in New-York City. While Kid Glyde shares his passion for breaking with the next generation at his Harlem studio, three thousand miles away in Anchorage Alaska, B-Boy Icey Ives, two-time US national champion, melts the ice with his local crew Frozen Flow while being a community leader, a teacher and a role model for the youth living in extremely challenging conditions.

programme.title: French breakers set the scene for Paris 2024 Olympic Games| Breaking Life
programme.desc: France is a cultural melting pot. It’s also one of the biggest countries for Breaking with more than a thousand battles every year and some of the greatest international competitions. It’s also in Paris 2024 that Breaking will make its Olympic debut. Dany Dann came to France from French Guyana to pursue a life in dance. Now, he juggles early morning shifts as a nurse, daily training and being a father – always with an eye on the next battle. Now reigning national champion, he trains with French national team members B-Girl Carlota and B-Boy Marlone for the WDSF World Breaking Championship in Paris.

programme.title: Young breakers take over the streets of Medellin | Breaking Life
programme.desc: Colombia used to be one of the most dangerous countries in the world but has found new life through a revival in urban arts, becoming a global creative mecca. B-Girl Luma and 4Eskuela hip hop school, where she learnt Breaking and is now a teacher, have been instrumental to this change in Medellin (Colombia). But it’s not been an easy journey for Luma who also had her doubts about what she can really achieve through dancing. By winning international dance events around the world, she is now confident it gave her a career and a drive, also when teaching young kids in her neighbourhood. She is keen to participate to Paris 2024.

programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.

programme.title: Tom Daley: the long and bumpy road to Olympic gold | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Thirteen years after his Olympic debut, the British diver finally landed the gold medal that was missing from his collection.

programme.title: Sakura Yosozumi: a skateboarding bloom that blossoms into Olympic gold | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: For the 19-year-old Sakura, skateboarding started as a way to play with her brother and ended with the first Olympic gold medal in women's park skateboarding.

programme.title: Armand Duplantis: flying high and smashing records | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Sweden's Armand "Mondo" Duplantis confirmed his status as the best pole vaulter in the world by seizing his first Olympic pole vault title by storm.

programme.title: Rebeca Andrade: an Olympic fairytale | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Brazilian gymnast Rebeca Andrade's long and bleak climb from the favelas of Sao Paulo to the podium in Tokyo is a true Olympic fairytale.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Cycling
programme.desc: Journey through the exciting Olympic Games glories on the track and road with cycling in its early days through to Chris Hoy and Team GB.

programme.title: France’s Tony Estanguet I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of France’s three-time gold medallist Tony Estanguet, who is now leading the Paris 2024 team.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Nicka takes it to the next level | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As b-girl Nicka continues her intense preparation for the Games, Anti is about to take on a new opponent at the WDSF Breaking for Gold Series in Hong Kong: Japanese b-girl Ayane, whose brother b-boy Shigekix has already confirmed his spot on Team Japan. The energy in Hong Kong is intense as Ayane tries to make a final push to reach the Olympic Qualifiying Series.

programme.title: Ayane and Shigekix, a breaking family | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Meet London-based b-girl Stefani who dances for Ukraine. Even though Ukraine’s breaking team is scattered across the globe, it doesn't dampen her spirit — she's all about having fun. Stefani faces b-girl Ayane at Hong Kong. Back in Japan, brother and sister breaking duo Shigekix and Ayane started breaking together. Along the last two years of competition, Shigekix is emerging as a favourite for a medal.

programme.title: Who will join B-boy Victor for Team USA | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Victor has secured a spot on Team USA. Who else will make it to Paris 2024? Jeffro is training with b-girl Logistix in Colorado Springs for a pre-Olympic festival in Japan. Each of our world class breakers gears up for the Olympic Qualifier Series and then the ultimate challenge: Olympic Games Paris 2024.

programme.title: Teahupo'o Surf Camp | Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Experience the thrills and spills as seven surfers join an ISA surf camp at Teahupo'o, Tahiti's famed surf spot and the surfing venue for the Olympic Games Paris 2024. Determined to conquer the Olympic wave, they face their fears, push the boundaries and challenge the raw power of nature.

programme.title: Women’s Triathlon, London 2012
programme.desc: Witness the closest final in Olympic triathlon history. An unbelievable finish between a world-class field of ladies.

programme.title: How sport climbing star Shauna Coxsey found her sport | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Shauna Coxsey is a sport climbing sensation from the UK. With her motto “find something that makes you happy” she made it to the top and is now ready to step up to represent the sport at the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Bruce Lee first inspired this karate champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Saadi Abbas, a karateka from Pakistan, nearly gave up on his Olympic dream. After learning that the sport would join the Olympics in Tokyo, he jumped back into training despite injuries and a lack of funding. Now, he hopes to follow the example of Seoul 1988 bronze medallist Hussain Shah, who is from the same neighbourhood of Karachi, to qualify for the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Jordyn Barratt found herself through skateboarding | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Growing up in Hawaii, it’s not surprising that Jordyn was a surfer long before she stepped on a skateboard. But her life changed when she entered a skatepark for the first time. She finally felt at home and was able to express herself through her movements on the board. Now that skateboarding is an Olympic sport, she’s ready to represent her community on the biggest stage of all.

programme.title: How Peruvian star Lucca Mesinas fell in love with surfing | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Following his parents’ footsteps, Lucca fell in love with surfing at a young age thanks to long sessions in the water with family and friends. With a surprising competitive streak, Lucca has now qualified for the Tokyo 2020 Games, where surfing will make its Olympic debut.

programme.title: How fun fuels this Para-Taekwondo world champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: When Juan-Diego Garcia entered a dojang for the first time at age five, he knew he found his place. As success came against abled bodied competitors, other kids used to ask, “But he doesn’t have an arm, how did he win?” He always proved to himself and others he can do anything. Now, Mexico’s first-ever world champion in Para-Taekwondo is training harder than ever to represent his country and hometown at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games where the sport will make its debut.

programme.title: Margie Didal: do what you love - Philippines / Skateboarding I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Margie first encountered skateboarding while helping her mother sell street food to make ends meet. Now she supports her family as one of the top skateboarders in Asia. Being a skater, she is a bit of a rebel in Filipina culture, but she is the sport sensation of the country and a strong chance of a medal at Tokyo 2020. She is paving the way for the next generation of women in skateboarding.

programme.title: Arijah Haseeb: start playing anywhere - Pakistan / Cricket I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Her whole life, Arijah has been the only girl playing cricket on the streets with the boys of her neighbourhood. She was scouted to join the local academy with other girls pursuing the sport and quickly became one of the best players on the team. She now has the women’s national team in her sights.

programme.title: Tracie Leost: you can have it all - Canada / Ice Hockey I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Tracie is the first generation urban indigenous person in her family and she’s an Ice hockey coach, a graduate student of social work, and an ice fisher, At 16 years old, she ran 140 kilometres to raise awareness for missing and murdered indigenous women and girls and now she is empowering indigenous youth living in Winnipeg area.

programme.title: Lyla Nourtier: you can succeed - France / Weighlifting I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Lyla is a 15 year old weightlifter from a small village in France without much access to sports. We meet her at a turning point in her life as she plans to leave home to pursue her dream. She joins an elite sport and education program where she is the first ever female weightlifter.

programme.title: Can imagining success actually help you achieve it? | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Learn how these visualization techniques practiced by some of the world’s greatest Olympians could help you overcome the challenges in your day to day life.

programme.title: The inspiring story of the first woman to win an Olympic gold for Australia
programme.desc: In “The Lithgow Flash”, Marjorie Jackson recalls her early training leading up to two gold medals in 1952 and her life upon returning home.

programme.title: The incredible story of the orphan who made it to the Olympic podium
programme.desc: In “Game of Life”, Kriss Akabusi shares how he discovered running in the British Army and what it felt like to win silver in LA1984.

programme.title: The story of the basketball legend who never gave up on her Olympic dream
programme.desc: In “The Queen”, Brazilian legend Hortencia Marcari explains why she came out of retirement only months after giving birth.

programme.title: How a pioneering Egyptian swimmer broke boundaries and inspired the world
programme.desc: In “The Golden Fish”, Rania Elwani tells how her determination as an Olympic swimmer was matched only by her commitment to peruse her career as a doctor.

programme.title: How an Olympic champion swimmer almost drowned at London 1948
programme.desc: In “Sinking Dream”, Greta Andersen shares how her quest for a second gold was cut short when she blacked. But it didn’t define her career.

programme.title: Can an Olympic and Arsenal legend save a football team from relegation?
programme.desc: Cameroon & Arsenal football legend Lauren coaches a struggling amateur league team from East London. Will he help them avoid relegation?

programme.title: Can Jackie Silva get this Brazilian volleyball team to defeat their rival?
programme.desc: Brazilian Olympic gold medalist Jackie Silva lends her expertise to a Rio indoor volleyball team as they try to win their first event ever.

programme.title: Men’s Triathlon, London 2012
programme.desc: Brothers Alistair and Jonny Brownlee race against the world's best in the 2012 Olympic men's triathlon.

programme.title: Tokyo 2020 top scorer sets sights on World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Growing up in a rural town in Brazil, Richarlison took an unconventional path to success. He played for his hometown club until the age of 16. He embarked on a journey of many trials until he was signed by América Mineiro. His rise is nothing but remarkable with his move to Premier League club Tottenham. Tokyo 2020 was a dream tournament for him as he was given the fabled number 10 shirt and went on to win a Gold medal and the golden boot. Watch out for Richarlison who scored his country's first two goals at the 2022 World Cup.

programme.title: Iranian superstar ready to give all for national team | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Now one of Iran’s greatest ever footballers, Azmoun could have chosen volleyball but his father decided otherwise. He left Iran for Russia at the age of 18 to develop his talent and career. Unsuccessful striker at the 2018 World Cup, he made an impressive move to Bayer Leverkusen. Having now returned to the national team, he is ready to give it all for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

programme.title: World Cup winner from Argentinian football dynasty | World at their Feet
programme.desc: With a father, uncle and two older brothers all professionals, Alexis Mac Allister was destined for a life in football. All three brothers even achieved their dream of playing on the same team for Argentinos Juniors, which saw young Maradona starts his legendary career and played with their father in the late 70’s. As a very fine member of this Argentinian football dynasty, Mac Allister is aiming to weave his midfield magic at the World Cup.

programme.title: Japanese winger who qualified his team for the World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Having risen through the ranks at Kawasaki Frontale, Kaoru Mitoma made the unorthodox decision to go to University and not enter professional football. Now at Premier League Brighton, Mitoma’s greatest success so far has been for the national team so far. Scoring two vital goals to secure his nation's place at the World Cup. He is now ready to tackle the competition to come.

programme.title: The New-Zealand striker who made his dreams come true | World at their Feet
programme.desc: As one of only six kiwis to ever to play in Premier League, Chris Wood has achieved more than he could have ever imagined. Schooled by his football playing sister, Chris moved to England at the age of 15 and made his Premier League debut at 17. After a challenging period of loan moves, Wood met success with Millwall and a personal achievement at London 2012. Now a regular striker at Newcastle United, Wood’s New Zealand has just missed out on World Cup qualification. Arguably the nation’s greatest ever player, he has sights set on another great stage, Paris 2024 where he would be participating in the Olympics for the 3rd time.

programme.title: Talented midfielder Louza sets hope for Paris 2024 | World at their Feet
programme.desc: The talented midfielder from Watford was desperately unlucky and suffered ligament damage ruling him out of the World Cup selection for Morocco. A product of Nantes F.C. football academy, he joined the UK Premier League as well as debuting and scoring at his first game with the national team. At just 23, he now sets his hopes on Paris 2024.

programme.title: Boxing vs weightlifting with Shimizu Satoshi & Takao Hiroaki | Sports Swap Japan
programme.desc: Can Olympic boxing bronze medallist snatch 40 kg on his first attempt?

programme.title: Archery vs race walk with Kanie Miki & Tanii Takayuki | Sports Swap Japan
programme.desc: What happens when a race walk champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Meet Japan's 16-year-old sport climbing sensation | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Mori Ai started climbing walls when she was eight. After competing and winning the World Championships, she is focused on being one of the world's top climbers.

programme.title: The future of Japan's table tennis belongs to this 13-year-old prodigy | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Harimoto Miwa's older brother Tomokazu has been the face of Japanese table tennis. Still, he is not the only Harimoto shouldering the hopes of a nation as Miwa is making a name of her own.

programme.title: Speed and grace
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 2 : The story of Women at the Games, Speed and grace.

programme.title: This Skater-girl is inspiring a new generation of skateboarders | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Ogawa Kihana was born in Fujisawa and began skateboarding after imitating her brother when catching waves. She is working hard to be an inspiration for younger female skateboarders

programme.title: Kyoto-born BMX rider is going for glory at Tokyo 2020 | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Nakamura Rim has been on wheels since his childhood. With BMX freestyle set to debut at the Olympic Games in Tokyo, Rim is eyeing more than just a gold medal on home turf.

programme.title: This future star of Japanese Judo is following in his father's footsteps | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Saito Tatsuru the 17-year-old judoka, son of the two-time Olympic gold medallist and world champion Saito Hitoshi. His dream is to become an Olympic champion, like his father.

programme.title: Knowing what motivates you can help you stand out | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Motivation is your brain's way of keeping you going when times get tough, is the key to success in so many walks of life.

programme.title: How you can turn negative emotions into positives | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Mindfulness is about being aware of physical sensations and that’s why many Olympians use it to optimise their training and competition performance.

programme.title: The secret weapon we all have but might not be using | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Visualisation is a technique in which you use your imagination to picture challenges ahead of you to help you achieve them in real life.

programme.title: Netherlands’ Pieter van den Hoogenband (extended)
programme.desc: Dutch swimming legend Pieter van den Hoogenband won seven Olympic medals. Now, he’s helping others swim their fastest.

programme.title: Spain’s “Las Niñas de Oro” (extended)
programme.desc: “Las Niñas de Oro” were the youngest Spanish Olympic medallist when they won gold in Atlanta 1996. They continue to inspire younger generations, including the Rio 2016 silver medallist Spanish national team.

programme.title: How a secret source of inspiration helped Billy Mills win gold in Tokyo
programme.desc: In “Wings of an Eagle”, Native American Billy Mills’ tells the personal journey that helped him heal his pain over the loss of his mother.

programme.title: Changing Times
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 3 : The story of Women at the Games, Changing Times.

programme.title: How Christine Girard was finally awarded the gold medal she deserved
programme.desc: After Girard finished in 4th place at Beijing 2008, the Canadian weightlifter fell into a depression. She worked back into shape for London 2012, where she finished in third. But now, after disqualifications due to doping and the reallocation of medals, she is finally awarded the Olympic medals she deserved.

programme.title: After unspeakable sadness, Skujyte finds redemption in reallocated medal
programme.desc: After years of doubt, doping sanctions saw Lithuanian heptathlete Austra Skujyte upgraded from fifth place in the London 2012 heptathlon to the bronze medal. Watch how she found overdue redemption following her fourth and final Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Betty Heidler received her silver medal after a seven-year wait
programme.desc: The German hammer thrower was upgraded to the silver medal after the re-analysis of control samples and the disqualification of multiple competitors. She describes feeling a mix of emotions upon the news that she would finally be awarded the Olympic medal that she deserved.

programme.title: How sport climbing star Shauna Coxsey found her sport | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Shauna Coxsey is a sport climbing sensation from the UK. With her motto “find something that makes you happy” she made it to the top and is now ready to step up to represent the sport at the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Bruce Lee first inspired this karate champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Saadi Abbas, a karateka from Pakistan, nearly gave up on his Olympic dream. After learning that the sport would join the Olympics in Tokyo, he jumped back into training despite injuries and a lack of funding. Now, he hopes to follow the example of Seoul 1988 bronze medallist Hussain Shah, who is from the same neighbourhood of Karachi, to qualify for the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Jordyn Barratt found herself through skateboarding | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Growing up in Hawaii, it’s not surprising that Jordyn was a surfer long before she stepped on a skateboard. But her life changed when she entered a skatepark for the first time. She finally felt at home and was able to express herself through her movements on the board. Now that skateboarding is an Olympic sport, she’s ready to represent her community on the biggest stage of all.

programme.title: How Peruvian star Lucca Mesinas fell in love with surfing | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Following his parents’ footsteps, Lucca fell in love with surfing at a young age thanks to long sessions in the water with family and friends. With a surprising competitive streak, Lucca has now qualified for the Tokyo 2020 Games, where surfing will make its Olympic debut.

Being a skater, she is a bit of a rebel in Filipina culture, but she is the sport sensation of the country and a strong chance of a medal at Tokyo 2020. programme.desc: Lyla is a 15 year old weightlifter from a small village in France without much access to sports. We meet her at a turning point in her life as she plans to leave home to pursue her dream. She joins an elite sport and education program where she is the first ever female weightlifter.

programme.desc: Learn how these visualization techniques practiced by some of the world’s greatest Olympians could help you overcome the challenges in your day to day life.

programme.desc: In “The Lithgow Flash”, Marjorie Jackson recalls her early training leading up to two gold medals in 1952 and her life upon returning home.

programme.desc: In “Game of Life”, Kriss Akabusi shares how he discovered running in the British Army and what it felt like to win silver in LA1984.

programme.title: How an Olympic champion swimmer almost drowned at London 1948
programme.desc: In “Sinking Dream”, Greta Andersen shares how her quest for a second gold was cut short when she blacked. But it didn’t define her career.

programme.title: Can an Olympic and Arsenal legend save a football team from relegation?
programme.desc: Cameroon & Arsenal football legend Lauren coaches a struggling amateur league team from East London. Will he help them avoid relegation?

programme.title: Can Jackie Silva get this Brazilian volleyball team to defeat their rival?
programme.desc: Brazilian Olympic gold medalist Jackie Silva lends her expertise to a Rio indoor volleyball team as they try to win their first event ever.

programme.title: Men’s Triathlon, London 2012
programme.desc: Brothers Alistair and Jonny Brownlee race against the world's best in the 2012 Olympic men's triathlon.

programme.title: Rise of Women Olympians
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 1 : The story of Women at the Games, Rise of Women Olympians.

programme.desc: Nakamura Rim has been on wheels since his childhood. With BMX freestyle set to debut at the Olympic Games in Tokyo, Rim is eyeing more than just a gold medal on home turf.

programme.title: This future star of Japanese Judo is following in his father's footsteps | Heroes Of the Future - Japan
programme.desc: Saito Tatsuru the 17-year-old judoka, son of the two-time Olympic gold medallist and world champion Saito Hitoshi. His dream is to become an Olympic champion, like his father.

programme.title: Knowing what motivates you can help you stand out | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Motivation is your brain's way of keeping you going when times get tough, is the key to success in so many walks of life.

programme.title: How you can turn negative emotions into positives | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Mindfulness is about being aware of physical sensations and that’s why many Olympians use it to optimise their training and competition performance.

programme.title: The secret weapon we all have but might not be using | Olympic State of Mind
programme.desc: Visualisation is a technique in which you use your imagination to picture challenges ahead of you to help you achieve them in real life.

programme.title: Netherlands’ Pieter van den Hoogenband (extended)
programme.desc: Dutch swimming legend Pieter van den Hoogenband won seven Olympic medals. Now, he’s helping others swim their fastest.

programme.title: Spain’s “Las Niñas de Oro” (extended)
programme.desc: “Las Niñas de Oro” were the youngest Spanish Olympic medallist when they won gold in Atlanta 1996. They continue to inspire younger generations, including the Rio 2016 silver medallist Spanish national team.

programme.title: How a secret source of inspiration helped Billy Mills win gold in Tokyo
programme.desc: In “Wings of an Eagle”, Native American Billy Mills’ tells the personal journey that helped him heal his pain over the loss of his mother.

programme.title: Changing Times
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 3 : The story of Women at the Games, Changing Times.

programme.title: How Christine Girard was finally awarded the gold medal she deserved
programme.desc: After Girard finished in 4th place at Beijing 2008, the Canadian weightlifter fell into a depression. She worked back into shape for London 2012, where she finished in third. But now, after disqualifications due to doping and the reallocation of medals, she is finally awarded the Olympic medals she deserved.

programme.title: After unspeakable sadness, Skujyte finds redemption in reallocated medal
programme.desc: After years of doubt, doping sanctions saw Lithuanian heptathlete Austra Skujyte upgraded from fifth place in the London 2012 heptathlon to the bronze medal. Watch how she found overdue redemption following her fourth and final Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Betty Heidler received her silver medal after a seven-year wait
programme.desc: The German hammer thrower was upgraded to the silver medal after the re-analysis of control samples and the disqualification of multiple competitors. She describes feeling a mix of emotions upon the news that she would finally be awarded the Olympic medal that she deserved.

programme.title: How sport climbing star Shauna Coxsey found her sport | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Shauna Coxsey is a sport climbing sensation from the UK. With her motto “find something that makes you happy” she made it to the top and is now ready to step up to represent the sport at the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Bruce Lee first inspired this karate champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Saadi Abbas, a karateka from Pakistan, nearly gave up on his Olympic dream. After learning that the sport would join the Olympics in Tokyo, he jumped back into training despite injuries and a lack of funding. Now, he hopes to follow the example of Seoul 1988 bronze medallist Hussain Shah, who is from the same neighbourhood of Karachi, to qualify for the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Jordyn Barratt found herself through skateboarding | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Growing up in Hawaii, it’s not surprising that Jordyn was a surfer long before she stepped on a skateboard. But her life changed when she entered a skatepark for the first time. She finally felt at home and was able to express herself through her movements on the board. Now that skateboarding is an Olympic sport, she’s ready to represent her community on the biggest stage of all.

programme.title: How Peruvian star Lucca Mesinas fell in love with surfing | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Following his parents’ footsteps, Lucca fell in love with surfing at a young age thanks to long sessions in the water with family and friends. With a surprising competitive streak, Lucca has now qualified for the Tokyo 2020 Games, where surfing will make its Olympic debut.

programme.title: How fun fuels this Para-Taekwondo world champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: When Juan-Diego Garcia entered a dojang for the first time at age five, he knew he found his place. As success came against abled bodied competitors, other kids used to ask, “But he doesn’t have an arm, how did he win?” He always proved to himself and others he can do anything. Now, Mexico’s first-ever world champion in Para-Taekwondo is training harder than ever to represent his country and hometown at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games where the sport will make its debut.

programme.title: Margie Didal: do what you love - Philippines / Skateboarding I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Margie first encountered skateboarding while helping her mother sell street food to make ends meet. Now she supports her family as one of the top skateboarders in Asia. Being a skater, she is a bit of a rebel in Filipina culture, but she is the sport sensation of the country and a strong chance of a medal at Tokyo 2020. She is paving the way for the next generation of women in skateboarding.

programme.title: Arijah Haseeb: start playing anywhere - Pakistan / Cricket I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Her whole life, Arijah has been the only girl playing cricket on the streets with the boys of her neighbourhood. She was scouted to join the local academy with other girls pursuing the sport and quickly became one of the best players on the team. She now has the women’s national team in her sights.

programme.title: Tracie Leost: you can have it all - Canada / Ice Hockey I By Her Rules
programme.desc: Tracie is the first generation urban indigenous person in her family and she’s an Ice hockey coach, a graduate student of social work, and an ice fisher, At 16 years old, she ran 140 kilometres to raise awareness for missing and murdered indigenous women and girls and now she is empowering indigenous youth living in Winnipeg area.

programme.title: Mariah: A Boxer’s Dream | Film
programme.desc: 16-year-old Navajo boxer Mariah Bahe is fighting against all odds to become the first female Native American Olympic boxer.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Cycling
programme.desc: Journey through the exciting Olympic Games glories on the track and road with cycling in its early days through to Chris Hoy and Team GB.

programme.title: Men’s Golf Individual Stroke Play, Rio 2016
programme.desc: Golf's return to the Olympic Games after more than a century is marked by a dramatic contest that is only decided on the 18th hole.

programme.title: Table Tennis vs Cricket with Sharath Kamal and Harbhajan Singh | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can bowler Harbhajan Singh make use of his spinning skills in table tennis? What happens when a table tennis champion becomes a cricket bowler?

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: Hockey vs Cricket with Savita Punia and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: India’s national hockey team goalkeeper Savita Punia swaps her hockey stick for a cricket bat. Can her skills in hockey help her become a better cricketer?

programme.title: Enzo Lefort's quest for individual gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Explore Enzo Lefort's journey from his Guadeloupean roots to the Paris 2024 Olympics, driven by his ambition for individual gold. Witness his rigorous training regimen and unwavering determination, fueled by past victories at World Championships and Olympic Games in the team events. As the Games draw near, Lefort's focus intensifies as he prepares to compete on home turf, aiming to etch his name in Olympic history with a triumphant performance in a memorable venue: le Grand Palais at the heart of Paris.

programme.title: B-Girl India aims for historic gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Follow India's remarkable journey from hometown studio of La Hague to the Olympic stage. While she qualified for the Games at the European Championships, with her unique style blending raw energy and finesse, she faces formidable rivals on her quest for breaking glory. Will her unmatched determination and skill make history at the Olympics where the sport is making its debut at Paris 2024?

programme.title: Kauli Vaast’s Tahitian roots make him a favourite for Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Witness Kauli Vaast's journey from his childhood Tahitian shores to the world stage. Surrounded by his family and long time friend and mentor Jeremy Flores, he refines his craft at Teahupo'o impressive pipe where he will compete on hometurf for an Olympic Gold medal in surfing. Driven by passion and cheered on by those who believe in his dream, he balances the thrill of competition with the warmth of a unique community.

programme.title: Kieran Reilly’s ride to the world stage | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Join Kieran Reilly on his quest for Olympic glory as he reflects on his journey from Gateshead to becoming BMX world champion. He navigates the challenges of training, family support, and personal growth, while striving to make his hometown proud. Follow his inspirational story as he prepares to represent his community at the next Olympic Games in Paris 2024.

programme.title: Teresa Portela Olympic longevity makes her a legend | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Marked by determination, Teresa Portela's journey unfolds over six Olympics. From Rio to Tokyo, Portela's pursuit of Olympic glory was balanced between being an elite athlete and the joys of motherhood. In Tokyo, she finally won a long-awaited medal by bringing home silver in the K-1 200 canoe sprint event. Now training for Paris 2024, she will become the first Spanish woman to compete in seven Olympic Games.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Middle Distance
programme.desc: The stories behind the key moments in middle distance running at the Olympic Games, including stars like Paavo Nurmi and Maria Mutola.

programme.title: The Vault, Treasures of the Olympics | Full Length
programme.desc: For the first time, Historian Greg Jenner and Olympian Jeanette Kwayke are given full access to go behind the scenes of the world’s greatest and most secure sporting collections to uncover the Treasures of the Olympics.

programme.title: Greg and Jeanette go behind the scenes at the Olympic Museum | The Vault
programme.desc: Greg Jenner and Jeanette Kwayke are left alone one night at the Olympic Museum and get to discover its unique sporting collection. The public space is stretched over 3000 square meters. But they’ve been given the keys of what happens below the galleries. Long corridors and secret rooms where 90.000 items are kept, collated, preserved, and restored.

programme.title: Derek Redmond makes an incredible donation from Barcelona 1992 | The Vault
programme.desc: Greg and Jeanette get to meet Olympic Legend Derek Redmond, one of the most emotional stories in the History the Games. In the best form he’s shown since he broke the British record, Derek is going for a gold or silver medal at Barcelona 1992. But in the semi-final, an injury will decide otherwise. The rest is part of History as his father joins him on the track in a highly emotional finish.

programme.title: Rulon | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: At the 2000 Olympic Games, American wrestler Rulon Gardner beat the unbeatable and became an overnight sensation. But what came after the ‘Miracle on the Mat’ was even more unpredictable.

programme.title: The Journey Begins
programme.desc: With the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games fast approaching, three of the best gymnasts in the world gear up for the most important year of their lives.

programme.title: Competition Season
programme.desc: Morgan and Angelina attempt to handle the pressure of the world stage. Will they succeed? Yile has a point to prove in training.

programme.title: The World Championships 2019
programme.desc: The World Championships are here. The three gymnasts learn whether they’re selected for their national teams. All the drama from the biggest competition of the season.

programme.title: Teahupo'o Surf Camp | Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Experience the thrills and spills as seven surfers join an ISA surf camp at Teahupo'o, Tahiti's famed surf spot and the surfing venue for the Olympic Games Paris 2024. Determined to conquer the Olympic wave, they face their fears, push the boundaries and challenge the raw power of nature.

programme.title: The Olympic Series: The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 4 : The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Triumph and Tragedy | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: In an emotional journey with his son and grandson, Finland’s Lasse Virén revisits the spot where he rose to his feet after a dramatic fall to win gold. The next day, the spirit of Munich was shattered when a terror attack at the Olympic Village took the lives of 11 Israeli athletes and coaches – a day of tragedy as told by an Israeli survivor, Shaul Ladany, and the gold medallists from around the world who bore witness.

programme.title: Ginter is the defensive rock for Germany at World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: He was the youngest player in the Germany squad which went on to win the World Cup in 2014. Silver medallist at Rio 2016 Olympic Games, he played for Borussia Dortmund and Borussia Mönchengladbach before moving back to his hometown club of SC Freiburg. But behind a very friendly and family man, he is the defensive rock to take Germany to a new glory in Qatar.

programme.title: David Raum is the new Mannschaft’s shooting star | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Written off and sent to play in the second Bundesliga in Germany, Raum helped to propel his club to first division. After joining the national team at Tokyo 2020, he made a meteoric rise to RB Leipzig. He is now part of the senior national team and ready to shatter his opponents’ defense at the 2022 World Cup.

programme.title: Kouyaté's fearless road to World Cup is a life lesson | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Cheikhou Kouyaté left Senegal as a teenager to begin his football journey at F.C. Brussels. London 2012 was instrumental to his integration in the national team, followed by solid moves to West Ham United and Crystal Palace. His last years success at African Cup of Nations propelled him to the next level at Nottingham Forest. He is now gearing up with the Lions for the World Cup hoping to make history.

programme.title: Spain’s number one keeper ready to shine at World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Establishing yourself as the number one keeper for Spain is no easy feat but thats what Unai Simón has been doing for two years now. As he recovered from his mistake at UEFA Euro 2020, he went on to win a silver medal at Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. He is now aiming to earn a new title with the Spanish team at the World Cup 2022 in Qatar.

programme.title: Bednarek leads a new generation of players for Poland | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Jan Bednarek is a strong and skillful centre back who now plays for Aston Villa. He was raised in a family obsessed with football, including his brother Filip, who plays professionally as a goalkeeper in their home country. Poland’s last success in an international tournament was winning Silver at the Barcelona 1992 Olympic Games but a new generation of players is ready to take the 2022 World Cup by storm.

programme.title: Elaine Thompson-Herah: One sprint to rule them all | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Elaine Thompson-Herah became the undisputed sprinting queen and the first woman to win the 100-200m double gold at consecutive Olympics.

programme.title: Neeraj Chopra: Throws his way into a nation's heart | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Neeraj Chopra makes Olympic history with the first-ever Olympic gold medal in track-and-field for India.

programme.title: Ariarne Titmus: Splashing into swimming royalty | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Ariarne Titmus went from chasing gold to being the one to beat after nail bitter 200m and 400m freestyle victories in Tokyo2020

programme.title: Carissa Moore: Carrying surfers' aloha spirit to the top of the podium | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How native Hawaiian Carissa Moore, honoured generations of surfers by winning the sport's first Olympic gold medal.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Gymnastics
programme.desc: Glorious gymnastics moments spanning the history of the Olympic Games, including Olga Korbut, Nadia Comaneci and Yukio Endo.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: United States’ Natalie Coughlin I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of twelve-time medallist, Natalie Coughlin, and what she is doing now.

programme.title: Japan’s Nomura Tadahiro I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Japan’s three-time gold medallist Nomura Tadahiro, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Nuffin for Nuffin | Documentary
programme.desc: Forty-five years after their first and only Olympic medal, Bermuda's hopes of glory now rest on the shoulders of a new generation of boxers. See how these young boxers overcome adversity and struggle beyond the ropes to keep this tiny island nation's Olympic dreams alive.

programme.title: The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 1 : The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games.

programme.title: Khalifa: An Olympic dream in the heart of Africa’s football powerhouse | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young Ghanian football player takes us into his world. Through his community, family and team we learn why football is so important to him and what he hopes to accomplish one day.

programme.title: Aya: the first female swimmer to represent Gabon at the Olympics | Playing Fields
programme.desc: An Olympic swimmer overcomes her tragic past and is determined to keep swimming. We see the inspiring relationship she has with her father as they train for future competitions.

programme.title: Ayomide: Born in a canoe, now a Nigerian rowing star | Playing Fields
programme.desc: Her mother gave birth to her inside a canoe some 20 years ago. Ayomide Bello grew up to become the first female canoeist from Nigeria to qualify for the Olympics.

programme.title: Can Dutch hockey legend Ellen Hoog help a team who doesn’t score win?
programme.desc: Three-time Olympic medalist Ellen Hoog tries to restore winning ways for a U19 girls hockey team in the Netherlands.

programme.title: Can USA's rugby coach Mike Friday transform India’s U17 female rugby team?
programme.desc: Team USA coach Mike Friday travels to Mumbai to train the Indian U17 Rugby 7's women's side, aiming to qualify for the Youth Olympics.

programme.title: Can this Finnish Olympic ice hockey legend change a Chinese team’s fortune?
programme.desc: See how 1988 Olympic silver medalist Rexi Ruotsalainen imparts his knowledge and expertise on the Huijia Green Dragons of Beijing.
